medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 70-year-old woman, experienced recurrent syncope after the addition of cisapride (5 mg/d) for bowel transit dysfunction. Initially, she had been treated with acebutolol (200 mg/d) and pirmenol (200 mg/d) for hypertension and frequent premature ventricular contractions, exhibiting normal QT interval. Following the addition of cisapride, she reported general malaise and syncope, with ECG telemetry showing severe bradycardia and prolonged QT interval on admission.
